page.title: 11Bro Ryan, Glanaman.
page.content: Bro Ryan is a housing complex built specifically for the elderly. It opened in 1984 and was named after the late Ryan Davies, a local entertainer. The complex consists of a number of bungalows built around a central hall. Each house is a separate and complete unit, which can be adapted for use by the disabled, and is linked to the warden's residence by an intercom system. This provides each resident with a method of contacting the warden, who is on call 24 hours a day. The community hall is the heart of the housing complex, where residents come together to meet, make friends and to enjoy numerous entertainments. Present-day (1985) residents number 42 men and women, the oldest being a lady of 92. They live within a secure, caring community, whilst maintaining their independance.
